intro: Diplothorax tonkinensis, commonly known as the Tonkin diplothorax, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly Vietnam, and is characterized by its distinctive two-lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in dense undergrowth. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in shades of pink or white. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
